results.title: The Day New Queer Cinema Said: Let’s Do This
results.abstract: Thirty years after a panel at Sundance, some of the artists and journalists who helped ignite an L.G.B.T.Q. film movement take stock.

multimedia.caption: Images from the Barbed-Wire Kisses panel at the 1992 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: ‘Buried,’ ‘Night Comes On’ and More Streaming Gems
results.abstract: Put these off-the-radar movies on your radar.
des_facet: Clive Davis: The Soundtrack of Our Lives (Movie)
The Diary of a Teenage Girl (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Ryan Reynolds in “Buried.”

results.title: Documentary Critical of Disney, From the Disney Family
results.abstract: A harsh portrait of pay inequality at the company, premiering at Sundance on Monday, was directed by the granddaughter of one of the founders.
des_facet: The American Dream and Other Fairy Tales (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Disneyland employees protesting low wages in the documentary “The American Dream and Other Fairy Tales.”

results.title: At Sundance, Two Films Look at Abortion and the Jane Collective
results.abstract: In the years leading up to Roe v. Wade, a Chicago group helped thousands of women obtain the procedure safely. A documentary and a feature tell their story.
org_facet: Abortion Counseling Service of Women's Liberation (Jane Collective)

multimedia.caption: Judith Arcana was part of the Jane Collective: “We knew that what we were doing was good work in the world,” she said. “And we knew that it was illegal.”
multimedia.copyright: Holly Andres for The New York Times

results.title: Can Works Like ‘Don’t Look Up’ Get Us Out of Our Heads?
results.abstract: In the doomsday smash and Bo Burnham’s pandemic musical “Inside,” themes of climate change, digital distraction and inequality merge and hit home.

multimedia.caption: Leonardo DiCaprio and Jennifer Lawrence star as two scientists desperate to get the American public and its leaders to react to a planet-killing comet in “Don’t Look Up.”

results.title: Watch a Seductive Moment in ‘The Power of the Dog’
results.abstract: Jane Campion narrates an intimate scene between Benedict Cumberbatch and Kodi Smit-McPhee.

results.title: Meat Loaf, ‘Bat Out of Hell’ Singer and Actor, Dies at 74
results.abstract: Born Marvin Lee Aday, he sold millions of albums, won a Grammy and acted in films including “The Rocky Horror Picture Show” and “Fight Club.”
results.byline: By Alex Marshall, Ben Sisario and Derrick Bryson Taylor

multimedia.caption: Meat Loaf’s album “Bat Out of Hell” went on to sell at least 14 million copies in the United States and generated songs that were radio staples — and barroom singalongs — for decades.

results.title: ‘Introduction’ Review: All Mixed Up
results.abstract: In his new film, the prolific South Korean director Hong Sangsoo tells a fractured coming-of-age story in three vignettes.

multimedia.caption: Shin Seokho, left, and Ye Jiwon in “Introduction,” the latest feature from Hong Sangsoo.

results.title: ‘Munich: The Edge of War’ Review: ‘Well Navigated, Sir’ (Not!)
results.abstract: With clenched jaws and furrowed brows, this plodding procedural attempts to glorify Neville Chamberlain, played here by Jeremy Irons.

multimedia.caption: Jeremy Irons as Neville Chamberlain in “Munich: The Edge of War.”

results.title: Jonathan Freeman, Jafar in ‘Aladdin,’ Hangs Up His Cobra Staff
results.abstract: He voiced the evil sorcerer in the Disney movies, and originated the character in the Broadway production. On Sunday, he took his final bow in the show.

multimedia.caption: Jonathan Freeman has been associated with the role of Jafar in “Aladdin” for 30 years, including a nearly eight-year run on Broadway. On Sunday, he passed the character’s staff to his successor, Dennis Stowe.
multimedia.copyright: An Rong Xu for The New York Times

results.title: The Tao of Wee Man
results.abstract: His world was radically altered by “Jackass.” But now, Jason Acuña has harnessed his fame to live the life of his dreams.

multimedia.caption: Jason Acuña.
multimedia.copyright: Chris Buck for The New York Times

results.title: What’s on TV This Week: ‘Promised Land’ and a Janet Jackson Special
results.abstract: ABC debuts a new drama about a wine-country power struggle. And a four-part documentary about Janet Jackson debuts on Lifetime and A&E.

multimedia.caption: John Ortiz, left, and Miguel Angel Garcia in “Promised Land.”

results.title: Louie Anderson and the Compassion of America’s Eternal Kid
results.abstract: He displayed an empathetic humanity that he shared offstage with his friend Bob Saget. The loss of both comics represents the end of an era.

multimedia.caption: Louie Anderson on “The Tonight Show” in 1984. He and Bob Saget started in stand-up around the same time.
multimedia.copyright: Joseph Del Valle/NBCUniversal, via Getty Images

results.title: Five Science Fiction Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: If you’re interested in alien invasions, vivid dreamscapes or adorable cats, this collection of streaming picks may be just right for you.

multimedia.caption: Julia Sarah Stone in “Come True.”

results.title: Why the Woman Who Dressed ‘The Gilded Age’ Is on the Verge of Giving Up
results.abstract: Helen Uffner has dressed Broadway, Hollywood and TV shows for more than 40 years. But high-rise developers and Amazon distribution centers are making it impossible to store her extraordinary vintage collection.

multimedia.caption: Helen Uffner’s collection of 20th century women’s wear, a go-to for costume designers, has been described as “extraordinary.”
multimedia.copyright: Sarah Blesener for The New York Times

results.title: ‘The Tiger Rising’ Review: A Cage of Clichés
results.abstract: A lonely boy finds an ally when he discovers a caged tiger in a forest behind his home, but imagination is somehow short-lived in this children’s movie.

multimedia.caption: From left, Dennis Quaid (Beauchamp), Christian Convery (Rob) and Madalen Mills (Sistine) in “The Tiger Rising.”

results.title: Hardy Kruger, German-Born Hollywood Star, Is Dead at 93
results.abstract: Escaping execution by the Nazis for “cowardice” as a soldier, he found success in films because he found ways to portray “the new, good German.”

multimedia.caption: The German actor Hardy Kruger and  Patricia Gozzi in the Oscar-winning French film “Sundays and Cybèle” (1962).

results.title: ‘Simple Passion’ Review: An Ordinary Erotic Tale
results.abstract: Adapted from a book by Annie Ernaux, the movie puts a female gaze on sexual obsession.

multimedia.caption: Laetitia Dosch and Sergei Polunin in “Simple Passion,” directed by Danielle Arbid.

results.title: ‘Salt in My Soul’ Review: Living, Even Thriving, With Illness
results.abstract: This documentary reconstructs the life of Mallory Smith, who died at 25 after a lifelong battle with cystic fibrosis.
des_facet: Salt in My Soul: An Unfinished Life (Book)

multimedia.caption: Mallory Smith and Jack Goodwin as seen in the documentary “Salt in My Soul.”

results.title: ‘A Shot Through the Wall’ Review: Tipping Justice’s Scales
results.abstract: In this drama about the killing of a Black man, the intersection of race and policing is considered from the perspective of a Chinese American police officer.

multimedia.caption: Kenny Leu as Mike Tan in “A Shot Through the Wall.”

results.title: ‘The King’s Daughter’ Review: Sinking or Swimming at Versailles
results.abstract: Pierce Brosnan stars as a version of King Louis XIV who seeks to sacrifice a mermaid for immortality in this puerile storybook fantasy that was shot nearly eight years ago.

multimedia.caption: Pierce Brosnan and Kaya Scodelario in “The King’s Daughter.”

results.title: ‘The Royal Treatment’ Review: Heavy is the Head (and Shoulders)
results.abstract: Laura Marano and Mena Massoud star in a romantic comedy that tweaks a familiar formula but still feels inane.

multimedia.caption: Mena Massoud and Laura Marano in “The Royal Treatment.”

results.title: ‘Donkeyhead’ Review: You Really Can’t Go Home Anymore
results.abstract: A writer living in Canada finds herself back home with her Punjabi immigrant parents.

multimedia.caption: From left, Huse Madhavji, Sandy Sidhu, Stephen Lobo and Agam Darshi in “Donkeyhead.”

results.title: ‘Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom’ Review: Remote Learning
results.abstract: In Pawo Choyning Dorji’s film, a teacher is assigned to a school that’s an eight-day walk from where he lives.
des_facet: Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Pem Zam, left, and Sangay Lham in “Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom.”

results.title: ‘The Last Thing Mary Saw’ Review: God Is Always Watching
results.abstract: In this thriller set in a Calvinist household in 1843, two women in love struggle against both patriarchal and supernatural forces to be together.

multimedia.caption: Stefanie Scott and Isabelle Fuhrman in “The Last Thing Mary Saw.”

results.title: ‘Definition Please’ Review: What Does It All Mean?
results.abstract: A grown-up spelling bee star who never left her hometown tries to make sense of the conflicts and challenges in her family.

multimedia.caption: From left, Sujata Day and Ritesh Rajan in “Definition Please,” a film written and directed by Day.

results.title: France’s Colonial Conflict, Filmed From Both Sides
results.abstract: “The Olive Trees of Justice,” a neorealist take on the Algerian War made with nonprofessional actors, is newly restored and still resonates today.

multimedia.caption: Jean Pélégri, left, and Pierre Prothon in “The Olive Trees of Justice,” based on Pélégri’s novel by the same name.

results.title: Jon Bernthal’s Guide to Making It as a Supporting Actor
results.abstract: Not being No. 1 on the call sheet has worked out pretty well for the “King Richard” cast member, who helped power that film to a SAG nomination.

multimedia.caption: Supporting actors “get to be hired assassins: We go in, throw down and walk away,” Bernthal said.
multimedia.copyright: Pat Martin for The New York Times

results.title: Gaspard Ulliel, French Actor and ‘Moon Knight’ Star, Dies at 37
results.abstract: He gained fame as a young Hannibal Lecter and the designer Yves Saint Laurent. He died after a skiing accident weeks before he is to appear in a Disney+ series.

multimedia.caption: Gaspard Ulliel in 2019. “His sensitivity and the intensity of his acting” made him “an exceptional actor,” the French culture minister said.

results.title: Jon Stewart to Receive Mark Twain Prize for American Humor
results.abstract: The comedian and former host of “The Daily Show” will receive the Kennedy Center’s annual comedy honor at a ceremony in April.
org_facet: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

multimedia.caption: Jon Stewart in 2014, before he stepped down from “The Daily Show.”

results.title: Jeremy Irons Is Transported by Renzo Piano and a Dog Named Smudge
results.abstract: The star of the new Netflix movie ‘Munich — The Edge of War’ discusses his first Broadway gig and the connection between Irish fiddling and jazz.

results.title: The Dumbledore of Clowning
results.abstract: The French master teacher Philippe Gaulier has worked with stars like Sacha Baron Cohen. But at 78, are his methods, which include insults, outdated?

multimedia.caption: Philippe Gaulier in the rehearsal studio at his school in France. Finding “your idiot,” as he calls it, is the essence of clowning.
multimedia.copyright: Cedrine Scheidig for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Nocturna’ Review: A Dark Night of the Soul
results.abstract: A seemingly haunted apartment building terrorizes a bewildered old man in this psychological thriller.

multimedia.caption: Pepe Soriano in “Nocturna.”
